On the other hand, the woman with dark hair doesn't have any such negative connotations attached to her appearance.

So, considering all this, maybe the woman with autism is more likely to be trivialized and thus less open to social interactions compared to someone without a stigmatized condition. But I'm not entirely sure because it's possible that both could be open depending on their individual circumstances.
